intro: Microlicia melastoma, commonly known as the red-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It attaches to host trees through haustoria, drawing water and nutrients from its host. Due to its ecological role and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
